content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

To define a struct `FloatWithUnits` and a `show` method for it in Julia, you can use the following code:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, fwu.value, " ", fwu.unit)
end
```

Now, you can create instances of `FloatWithUnits` and print them as desired:

```julia
julia> distance = FloatWithUnits(1.8, "meters")
1.8 meters

julia> println(distance)
1.8 meters
```

This `show` method will display the value and unit of the struct separated by a space when an instance of `FloatWithUnits` is printed or displayed in the Julia REPL.
